qas.question: What about Windows 8 was well received?

context: Windows 8 was released to a mixed critical reception. Although reaction towards <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>its performance improvements, security enhancements, and improved support for touchscreen devices<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> was positive, the new user interface of the operating system was widely criticized for <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>being potentially confusing and difficult to learn<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> (especially when used with a keyboard and mouse instead of a touchscreen). Despite these shortcomings, <a2_0><b7_0>60 million<b7_0/><a2_0/> Windows 8 licenses have been sold through January 2013, a number which included both upgrades and sales to OEMs for new PCs.
